prompt: Facts: Marriage between C. Mangesh (Appellant No. 1/Accused No. 1 - A-1) and deceased Manjula on 15.05.1996.; Alleged demand of Rs. 10,000 cash and 50 grams gold as dowry at the time of marriage.; Rs. 5,000 cash and 25 grams gold were allegedly given, with a promise to pay the balance later.; Prosecution alleged continuous harassment and torture of Manjula by A-1 (husband), A-2 (father-in-law T. Venkatappa), and A-3 (brother-in-law T. Narayanappa) for the remaining dowry.; Manjula was allegedly sent back to her parental home after about 6 months due to non-payment.; A panchayat was held, and Manjula was taken back to the matrimonial home.; On 11.07.1997 (within 1 year and 2 months of marriage), Manjula was found dead by hanging in her matrimonial home in Madhugiri Taluk, Tumkur District.; FIR registered based on the complaint by PW-1 (father of the deceased).; Post-mortem examination conducted by Dr. Hanumantharaya (PW-12) opined death due to asphyxia as a result of hanging.; Investigation led by PW-13 (Investigating Officer).; Charge-sheet filed against A-1, A-2, and A-3 under Sections 498-A, 304-B, 302 read with Section 34 IPC, and Sections 3 & 4 of the Dowry Prohibition Act, 1961.; Trial Court (Sessions Judge, Tumkur) acquitted all accused of all charges by judgment dated 31.01.2000, citing discrepancies in witness testimonies (PW-1, PW-2, PW-3) and lack of reliable evidence for dowry demand/cruelty 'soon before death'.; State of Karnataka appealed to the High Court of Karnataka.; High Court, by judgment dated 16.12.2005, reversed the acquittal in part: Convicted A-1, A-2, and A-3 under Section 304-B read with Section 34 IPC (7 years RI) and Section 498-A read with Section 34 IPC (3 years RI and fine of Rs. 2000 each). Acquittal under Section 302/34 IPC and Dowry Prohibition Act sections was confirmed.; High Court found the trial court's acquittal regarding Sections 304-B and 498-A to be perverse, relying on testimonies of PW-1 (father), PW-2 (mother), PW-3 (brother) and invoking the presumption under Section 113-B of the Indian Evidence Act.; The present appeal before the Supreme Court was filed by the convicted accused (A-1, A-2, A-3) against the High Court's judgment. | IPC: Section 34 (Common Intention), Section 302 (Murder - charged, acquitted by HC), Section 304B (Dowry Death - convicted by HC), Section 498A (Cruelty by Husband or Relatives - convicted by HC), Section 3 & 4, Dowry Prohibition Act, 1961 (Charged, acquitted by HC)
